name: Default value of attribute type (for <link>/<style>/<script>) does not need to be set. If set, it reports.
Attribute name must be lowercased. If not, it reports.
One element should not have duplicated attribute names. If found, it reports.
Attribute value must be closed by double quotes. If found not, it reports.
Value of boolean attributes should not be set. If found set, it reports.
Attribute name of <button> is not recommended to be set. If found set, it reports.
<meta charset> is recommended and it should be the first element child of <head>. If not found, or found at wrong position, it reports.
Attribute type of <button> is recommended to be set. If found not set, it reports.
All CSS contents (<link rel="stylesheet"> or <style>) are recommended to be imported in <head>. If found not in <head>, it reports.
The <!DOCTYPE> declaration is needed and HTML5 is recommended. If not found or found not HTML5, it reports.
Attribute lang of <html> recommended to be set. If found not set, it reports.
Value of attribute id or class should not contain ad-relative keyword, which may cause the element blocked by adblock software. If found so, it reports.
To display the webpage in edge mode, <meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=Edge"> is recommended. If not found, it reports.
Attribute alt of is recommended to be set. If found not set, it reports.
Attribute src of should not be empty (""), which may cause additional request for the document. If found so, it reports.
Attribute title of is not recommended to be set. If found set, it reports.
Attribute width & height of is recommended to be set, which can reduce re-layout while rendering. If found not set, it reports.
ClassName (value of attribute class) should be lowercased words connected with hyphens (- instead of _). If found not, it reports.
Id (value of attribute id) should be lowercased words connected with hyphens (- instead of _). If found not, it reports.
Elements should be nested abiding by specific rules. If found not, it reports.
Attribute rel of <link> (if not set) should be set as stylesheet.
JavaScript content must meet standard. htmlint tries to use config.linters.script as the lint method for script content.
All JavaScript content are recommended to be imported in the tail of <body>, which may improve the first-screen performance. If found not, it reports.
Check if void elements close themeselves with /. If found not matching config (close / no-close), it reports.
Special characters (<, >) in text content must be escaped. If found not, it reports.
CSS content (content of <style>) must meet standard. htmlint tries to use config.linters.style as the lint method for CSS content.
<style> should not be used, while using individual CSS file instead will improve maintainability. If <style> found, it reports.
Tags (except void elements) must be paired. If found not, it reports.
Tag names must be lowercased. If found not, it reports.
<title> required and it should be just after <meta> charset (<meta charset="...">). If not found or in wrong position, it reports.
Ids (value of attribute id) should be unique in page. If found duplicated ids, it reports.
Element's id and name should be unique in page. If found not, it reports.
<meta> for viewport (<meta name="viewport" content="...">) is required. If not found, it reports.
<input> should be associated with <label>. If found not, it reports.
